website_summaries.verdict: This Kenetrek boot is comfortable, but it is also beyond satisfactory when it comes to overall support and fit. Those who are looking for a quick break-in period may not find it in this day hiking gear, unfortunately. Overall, minus its manageable misstep, the Kenetrek Hardscrabble Hiker still stands as a worthy investment all thanks to its pool of impressive traits.
pros: The excellent level of comfort of this Kenetrek boot impressed scores of verified purchasers
More than a dozen of owners got a very precise fit in the Hardscrabble Hiker
Many users were genuinely pleased with the boot’s supportive build
Its justifiable price tag was greatly appreciated by numerous patrons
Some devoted hikers swore by the Kenetrek Hardscrabble Hiker’s unrelenting traction
Based on a handful of reports, this hiking gear is amply warm despite not having proper insulation
A few wearers said that they got a remarkably stable ride in the Hardscrabble Hiker
In terms of waterproofing, this gear didn’t disappoint a couple of testers
A wide-footed blogger lauded the roomy forefoot of the Hardscrabble Hiker from Kenetrek
cons: It took more than a handful of users a long time to break in this hiking gear
A professional footwear critic gave the boot a thumbs-down for having an outsole that peeled off too soon

customer_reviews.title: Best Boot on the Market
customer_reviews.text: Kennetrek is the BEST boot on the Market. Wore Danners for years until they started catering to the metro-sexual crowd. The Kennetreks fit like a glove and last forever. I am hard on boots and I got TWO YEARS out of my last pair. Never had a pair of boots last more than a year
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Tough boots. Even wear them around town in Fairbanks when it's negative 30 and my feat don't get cold in them. Has a high arch support but feat don't get tired on uneven terrain.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Grace

customer_reviews.title: Best boot but you pay for it
customer_reviews.text: Great boot so far- Only put about 100 miles in them. Will add to the review after my Jan 2020 Idaho Predator Hunt. Heard only good this from friends who have them as well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Blisters
customer_reviews.text: I wore these boots for 2 weeks in Colorado while elk hunting, after spending weeks breaking them in. Not only were they extremely heavy for hiking in but the last twelve days of my hunt were spent with 2 large painful blisters on my right heel. If you are looking for a shoe to ruin your plans these are your shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Joey Whitmoyer

customer_reviews.title: It's one of the best boots I have ever worn for initial fit and ...
customer_reviews.text: It's one of the best boots I have ever worn for initial fit and comfort ( very little break in ). I owned Vasques, Danner, Browning, Redwing, Rocky, Wolverine, ect. I have the upmost confidence in them to keep me glued to the side of the mountain.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Buchanan

customer_reviews.title: Bullet proof!!! 😃
customer_reviews.text: Got these for my son for Christmas and he loves them! The sole is kinda high which takes some getting used to but overall they are bullet proof! And he is very hard on shoes!
customer_reviews.author: Ranchwife

customer_reviews.title: tough boot
customer_reviews.text: I had a pair of mountain extremes but lost one in a sinking of an air boat. They were my favorite boots by far in my 62 years. I trust in the name that these will measure up.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Corning

customer_reviews.title: Most comfortable and rugged boots I've found! Expensive but worth it!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the insulated Guide Extreem for last winter. Then spring came, I hated all my old boots and my feet hurt. So now my feet are happy... overjoyed now in the summer.
customer_reviews.author: ADDrider

customer_reviews.title: Awesome boot!
customer_reviews.text: My second pair of Kenetrek. This is for summer use, and the other, Kenetrek Mountain Extreme, being insulated is for winter. Even without insulation, Hardscrabble are warm...I'll have to wait and see if they are too warm for summer. BL - the boots fit like a glove, are extremely well made, are extremely supportive for rough terrain, and work well in the elements. They do take awhile to break in, but are worth the effort.
customer_reviews.author: Bigdog

customer_reviews.title: High quality outdoor footwear
customer_reviews.text: These boots, for me, are used daily as I train hunting dogs. I find them comfortable, stable over rough terrain, and dry. The wide boot, which I use, is truly wide and aids in my foot comfort. Would recommend this product as it has lived up to it's reputation.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Nice boots.
customer_reviews.text: I like these boots so far, they took a little longer to break in than normal but they appear to be well made and rugged. They were expensive, I'm hoping they last for years and that will be the deciding factor on whether I really like them or not.
customer_reviews.author: Woodsman

customer_reviews.title: Solid and Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my son to go hunting in. He loves them!
customer_reviews.author: Susan A.

customer_reviews.title: Great boot.
customer_reviews.text: Best boots ever. Delivery was really fast. I’m a fire fight and live in boots. I have tried about every boot out there and the are the best.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Great Boots!
customer_reviews.text: I just retired to Talkeetna (AK) and these boots are now my 'go to' pair with winter having finally arrived. They are very comfortable, provide excellent support and have dealt well with the very wet fall up here. Very, very satisfied!
customer_reviews.author: Bill Was

customer_reviews.title: Greatness
customer_reviews.text: I liked everything! Wear liners and get the right size and these will be better than the rest!!!
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: I really good boot made for heavy backpack or hunting loads
customer_reviews.text: I really good boot made for heavy backpack or hunting loads, super supportive. Will require a break in time of approximately 25 miles but well worth it I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Jon/Kristy

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: very satisfied I wish they made this boot without such an aggressive sole
customer_reviews.author: Gary Lane

customer_reviews.title: They were so comfortable I bought a pair for going out for casual ...
customer_reviews.text: I use a pair identical to these for hunting. They were so comfortable I bought a pair for going out for casual nights on the town. Very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Mario Vasquez

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Looking for the same deal I got. Price was superb
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Just what I expected!
customer_reviews.text: The Kenetrek Hardscrabble Boots fit very well.Should of bought a pair years ago rather than punish my feet for all those years.Abuddy of mine had a pair for a time and said you wont be sorry,Well he was right.Very Glad I did.Looking to get a lot of use out of these boots.Thanks for a Great Boot!
customer_reviews.author: Richard J Tokarski

customer_reviews.title: They are very solid and stable but amazingly comfortable. Only con is pricy
customer_reviews.text: I have several famous boots such as Hanwag, Zambalan, Aku also I have foot problem(Morton's Nuroma). My ball is not wide but tried wide one. They are very solid and stable but amazingly comfortable. Only con is pricy.
customer_reviews.author: Seong Hoon Rim

customer_reviews.title: I love these, but the rubber on the outside edge ...
customer_reviews.text: I love these, but the rubber on the outside edge has dry rotted. This is the first time I've seen this happen on any set of boots I owned like this. That's the only reason for the three star rating...
customer_reviews.author: Road Dog 8654

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Best boot on the market. Expensive but will last for years.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: great boots. break in period about twenty miles. expensive but worth it.
customer_reviews.author: charles miller

customer_reviews.title: shoe fit perfect. take a while for break in
customer_reviews.text: shoe fit perfect. take a while for break in. took it hunting after one month of wearing around town and going to work. burning sensation on back of heel while climbing steep hill side( no blister). switch to thicker sock seem to help . even apply kenetrek wax seen to soften and make the leather darker. wear on a five day hunt. it was raining and shoe is totally dry with outdoor research gaiters.
customer_reviews.author: 916guy

customer_reviews.title: best elk hunting boot I have ever used
customer_reviews.text: best elk hunting boot I have ever used. legs seem to still be fresh at the end of the day with these boots.
customer_reviews.author: matthew vucelick

customer_reviews.title: GREAT BOOTS
customer_reviews.text: My husband has several pairs of Kenetrek boots that he uses for hunting so he was familiar with the size and fit. He saw these lower hiking style boots and just had to have them. He says they are by far the most comfortable brand of boots that he owns.
customer_reviews.author: Mrskoz

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Finally a pair of boots that are true to size
customer_reviews.author: Darin

customer_reviews.title: Wow!
customer_reviews.text: This are unquestionably the most comfortable and supportive hiking boots that I have ever worn. They are great! Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: David Franklin

customer_reviews.title: Great boots!
customer_reviews.text: I have Kenetrek insulated hunting boots that are super. These boots as well as my hunting boots fit perfect for long hours in the field.
customer_reviews.author: Jim R.

customer_reviews.title: The newer version of the hiking boot is much stiffer ...
customer_reviews.text: The newer version of the hiking boot is much stiffer and requires significant break in time compared the break in time required for the pair I purchased 5 years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Kirk R Parrish

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: These boots may seem expensive, but this is the third pair I bought. I have my own pair and I bought these for my husband for everyday wear on our farm. He already had the high tops for hunting. We both have had sore feet by the end of the day with other shoes, even high quality ones, but these feel like air cushions even at the end of the day. Worth every single penny!
customer_reviews.author: Fran

customer_reviews.title: Simply, WOW!
customer_reviews.text: Finally, a boot that fits properly at size 10 or Euro 43. I have gotten many size 9.5D that fit too tight; or 10E that fit too big; and some 10EE that fit almost perfect. This boot from Kennetrek fits like a glove, and has room for an expanding foot after many hours of wear. Thank you, thank you, thank you! This "Hardscrabble" hiking boot is well built, with excellent materials, and highly stiff for walking over rocks, rough terrain, and cliffs or uphill/downhill. Just awesome boot!
customer_reviews.author: Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Why did I wait so long
customer_reviews.text: I know these things where expensive but OMG they are worth it. I never thought of paying money like this for boots before. I have gone through tons of boots over the years always trying to save a buck or two. I should have just purchased these and would have been happier way sooner. The comfort while hiking through rough terrain is amazing. These things are just awesome. They keep my feet dry and are just awesome. I cannot say how they will hold up as I have only a few miles on them but they feel great.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey D. Weeks

customer_reviews.title: Great Boot - Suggestion to First Time Buyers
customer_reviews.text: Love these boot for elk hunting in the rockies. Great fit but I noticed some reviewers talked of getting sore feet. I strongly suggest getting these boots 1/2 size bigger than normal. Then use 2 pairs of thick socks. This will keep your feet firmly in the boot but give you that needed extra padding. You can walk for days and days and never have a blister or even red areas. Change your socks daily if you can and your feet will love these boots. Also, I treat them with snow seal before and after every hunt. Keeps the leather flexible, water resistant and protected. Happy hunting!
customer_reviews.author: Target

customer_reviews.title: Very uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: I have worn these boots for several months. They are extremely uncomfortable. I will not buy another pair. Like someone else said if you’re looking for a boot to ruin your hunt these are the ones you need
customer_reviews.author: joanah green

customer_reviews.title: great boots!!
customer_reviews.text: I would rate these boots as the best I have used. Buy them -you will be happy you did. comfortable, supportive, sole that rocks your foot and durable.
customer_reviews.author: Charley Fan

product_meta.title: Kenetrek Mens Hardscrabble Hiker Hardscrabble Hiker
product_meta.description: Whether in full pursuit, driving down the road, or on your feet all day, these very light, black tactical style boots are designed for a 24/7 workout. The padded collars and special flex notch gives you high-top tennis shoe comfort built on our mountain hunting boot support system. The Hardscrabble Black features our legendary K-Talon Outsole. Available in men's sizes (whole & half): medium (8-12,13,14) Made in Italy.
feature_bullets: One piece vamp with no seams down the tongue for better abrasion resistance and water proofing
7mm nylon midsole and custom K-Talon lugged sole
